meanings.definition: To tremble or shake involuntarily, typically as a result of fear or disgust.
meanings.sent1: She shudders at the thought of spiders.
meanings.sent2: He always shudders when watching horror movies.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house made her shudder with fear.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident made him shudder with dread.
meanings.sent5: The cold wind made her shudders visible to everyone.

meanings.definition: A sudden convulsive movement caused by fear or cold.
meanings.sent1: His shudders were noticeable in the chilly room.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected noise caused a shudder in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly dance brought a shudder of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds cast a shudder over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The icy water sent shudders through his body.
